desc: https://github.com/willyb321?tab=stars - theres a lot of good stuff here just basically search for something and its probable youll find something :)
https://github.com/0x90 - this guys made some great wireless tools.
https://github.com/NORMA-Inc/AtEar - Wireless Hacking, WiFi Security, Vulnerability Analyzer, Pentestration
https://github.com/0xd012/wifuzzit - 802.11 fuzzer (vuln scanner basically)
https://github.com/aanarchyy/bully - pretty much a staple now
https://github.com/JPaulMora/Pyrit - precomputed cracker
https://github.com/carpedm20/awesome-hacking - good stuff
https://github.com/jopohl/urh - not used this yet but its looking pretty fancy
https://github.com/macmade/KeychainCracker - this is (afaik) one of the only keychain crackers
https://github.com/JPaulMora/CrackingTools - scripts to look up hashes on online dbs
https://github.com/brannondorsey/wifi-cracking - fairly easy to follow tutorial for wifi cracking
https://github.com/derv82/wifite2 - a rewrite of (imo) one of the best wifi auto cracking tools
https://github.com/DanMcInerney/wifijammer - does what it says on the tin - jams wifi
https://github.com/kylemcdonald/FreeWifi - another tutorial for wifi cracking / free wifi
https://github.com/xdavidhu/mitmAP - very nice MITM tool
https://github.com/NSAKEY/nsa-rules - some hashcat rules
https://github.com/MisterBianco/BoopSuite - up and coming wireless pentesting suite
https://github.com/faizann24/wifi-bruteforcer-fsecurify - android wifi bruteforcer
https://github.com/mubix/osx-wificleaner - clean out non protected wifi from macOS
https://github.com/akamajoris/AWPA - interesting WPA2 brute force written in golang
https://github.com/brendan-rius/c-jwt-cracker - multi-threaded JWT brute-force cracker written in C
https://github.com/iphelix/dnschef - DNS proxy
https://github.com/nxxxu/AutoPixieWps - havent tried this one, supposedly automatically attacks WPS with Pixie
https://github.com/0x90/wifi-arsenal - massive amount of WiFi related tools
https://github.com/reverse-shell/routersploit - an open-source exploitation framework dedicated to embedded devices.
https://github.com/samyk/poisontap - A very good tool from samyk
https://github.com/n1nj4sec/pupy - cross-platform remote administration and post-exploitation tool mainly written in python
https://github.com/vulnersCom/getsploit - Command line utility for searching and downloading exploits
https://github.com/PenturaLabs/Linux_Exploit_Suggester - Linux Exploit Suggester; based on operating system release number
https://github.com/SafeBreach-Labs/pwndsh - post-exploitation framework (and an interactive shell) developed in Bash
https://github.com/SigPloiter/SigPloit - Telecom Signaling Exploitation Framework - SS7, GTP, Diameter & SIP
https://github.com/cliffe/secgen - fork of SecGen, Create randomly insecure VMs
https://www.parrotsec.org/ - fancy af pentesting os
https://www.kali.org/ - The primo pentesting os
https://github.com/zardus/ctf-tools - list of good tools for CTFs

https://www.rapid7.com/db/modules/auxiliary/scanner/smb/pipe_auditor - named pipe auditor is an excellecent method to gain situation awareness on a target. It can give you insight into what is running on the machine via named pipes
